website_summaries.verdict: Its immersive 32:9 aspect ratio, lifelike color range, and buttery-smooth imagery easily makes this a superb curved monitor for gaming.
pros: Quantum Dot technology displays over 1 billion colors
cons: This extra-large gaming curved monitor is extra pricey

website_summaries.verdict: A gorgeous, adaptable, and absolutely gigantic curved monitor that should impress everyone.
pros: Sports an innovative 32:9 aspect ratio, deep 1800R curve, HDR, ultra-smooth 144Hz refresh rate, optimized gaming settings, a multitasker’s dream, highly adjustable, and did we mention it’s really big?
cons: Easily the most expensive curved monitor from Samsung

customer_reviews.title: Awesome beast
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this in June, got it in September. Wow, it's a killer! Great colors and contrast. When playing a game at full screen, it's so engrossing because it fills your peripheral vision. Actually got me a bit nauseous for a while, but getting used to it now. Running it with a GTX1080. Only thing I would like to improve would be the vertical size, to get it up to 1280 pixels vertically. Awesome beast! Some older games don't support it full screen, but that's to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: MotherTucker

customer_reviews.title: Defective and a Pain to Troubleshot
customer_reviews.text: As many other people have complained about: dead pixels and defective from waking up from sleep. To top, Samsung doesn’t care. If this thing wasn’t so ridiculous, and perhaps never to be seen again in this size, I decided to keep mine and just put up with the bad quality. After you troubleshoot it and it does work, it really is an amazing experience. Tip for frozen screen (works 50% of the time without unplugging): click the power button once, click down, and click the power button once more. Even if you can’t see it the menu is still there and you can shut it off and on. Again, only works sometimes. Other times even the menu is defective.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Hartley

customer_reviews.title: If you want the best.......
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely gorgeous! I use it for CAD, not gaming, but the difference for me is that I went from two Samsung 27" curved monitors which were great, to this one, and now the best part!!! I have no frame in the middle of my desk, and I can easily work on a large drawing in the CENTER of my desk, with the other programs I use to each side. I love this monitor!!! I'm driving it with a Quadro P4000 using the DP, and Mini DP connections. The best setup I ever had!
customer_reviews.author: Audiogeek

customer_reviews.title: 1080p is not acceptable for $979
customer_reviews.text: The 49” monitor is the perfect size but unfortunately the resolution is garbage My monitor came with lots of ghosting On both sides of the monitor not worth the price at all to me bad resolution and bad quality control is a no go for me
customer_reviews.author: hatem abujad

customer_reviews.title: Cool monitor, but just not practical.
customer_reviews.text: 1. Looks great, but screen heavily focused on gaming and not well rounded. 2. Refresh rate is reduced when connection second cable, what?! 3. Software tools cheaply put together. 4. Drivers not convinent to install. 5. Can easily adjust screen (tilt, heights, etc) like my beautiful dell monitor. 5.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Weird glitch on original and replacement
customer_reviews.text: I love the monitor, but this glitch makes it unusable for me. It seems related to the not waking up from sleep issue as I also have to unplug the monitor and replug it to make it work again. Every once in a while, sometimes multiple times a day, the monitor goes into this glitch mode. Amazon sent me a replacement and within a day it's exhibiting the same problem. Am I the only one having this issue?
customer_reviews.author: Fabric of the Universe

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Crisp, Clear, Vibrant colors. Great for the games I play, Windows 10 picked up the display immediately, and all my native windows apps display full screen now. Running it at 3840 x 1080, 120 Hz refresh. Very pleased. The software that is supplied is just a configuration utility that is pretty useless, but I can do all the configuration I need in Windows and NVidia control panels. If there are any cons to this it is that video sites (VUDU, Netflix) can not handle the larger display and the video is displayed in the center. The colors and resolution of the videos are still great though.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Von Wert

customer_reviews.title: It's fine.  If I had it to do again, I wouldn't.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a gamer, I was looking for 2d real estate. 2 high quality 32" or better curved monitors would have probably been a better purchase. It does have a "wow" value when people see my xterms accross contiguous 49 inches, which is worth something, I s'pose. It's really heavy, too, which is a minus.
customer_reviews.author: Marc PhillipsTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: The best monitor under 1k
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this from a 144hz Asus 4k and I really thought I would miss the 4k. I've had this for about 6 months now and I can firmly say while I do miss the 4k, the OLED and the size are a much better tradeoff. I do wish this had an ambient light sensor like the newer Samsung TVs. Tip: make sure your game actually supports this resolution. Most games do not properly support this. But even if your game doesn't support this, the monitor is still excellent for work.
customer_reviews.author: Bamazon

customer_reviews.title: Monitor died
customer_reviews.text: Not recommended my monitor just stop working after 10 months of use, actually its a power issue, and after reading a little bit people said that is actually a known issue with this monitors, very expensive monitor for this kind of problems
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 8-bit depth with HDR?
customer_reviews.text: I give this monitor 4 our of 5 stars as it is an HDR monitor with 8-bid depth. If this was 10-bit depth I would give it an easy 5 stars with a 1000 nits. If you are looking for an HDR monitor buy something else as I run HDR disabled in Windows 10 because HDR enabled on this monitor washes everything out. This is because this monitor does not have the level of brightness necessary (1000 nits) nor 10-bit depth. Great monitor but if you are looking for HDR then look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: A. Deutschlander

customer_reviews.title: but it could use some better software for window position management
customer_reviews.text: I'm on the fence about this monitor. I'm really enjoying it in general, but it could use some better software for window position management. I'm using Mosaic right now, and it mostly solves my issues, but a huge monitor like this could use some software tools. Keep in mind that looking from your start button to your task manager is a significant distance unless you're far away from your monitor. One interesting note is that this monitor actually made me a little bit of nausea (like VR sickness) for the first 2-3 days I used it. It no longer does. I think that may be the curved screen, but I don't know.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Horecka

customer_reviews.title: Good 49 inch monitor for gaming or office work
customer_reviews.text: I stepped up/down from a 32-inch 4k monitor (3840 x 2160p) to this 49 inch (3840 x 1080p) and I really miss the higher resolution. Samsung has come out with a 5120 x 1440p model that would have been better for me. There is a 49-inch 7680 x 2160p on the horizon from LG that I will probably buy as a replacement for this one when the new one becomes available in a year or so.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Walker

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my MacBook Pro 2017
customer_reviews.text: It took some time to set it up for my MacBook Pro 2017 (at this point the latest model) but once I did it I'm happy with this purchase. I had very good monitors but colors and contrast on this one is like I've never seen before. Plus size (it matters in this case). If you use it with MacBook Pro with USB C-type be sure that you get HDMI 2.0 to USB C type cable. I got one on Amazon and it works great. I'm developer running Parallel Desktops on Mac. A lot of real-estate to comfortably write both Windows and iOS apps on the same computer. I hope macOS updates will not screw it up :)
customer_reviews.author: Kolle Smith

customer_reviews.title: I'm able to span 3 nice sized windows for when I'm working
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a gamer. This was for a productivity environment. I'm able to span 3 nice sized windows for when I'm working. Great for coding, spreadsheet work, anything you would typically use multi-monitors for. I wish the curvature/radius was a little lower, as the outer edges can be a little far away from your field of view. For gaming, this would be your periphery, and would be great for immersion. For productivity, it's less helpful. Having 3 widescreen monitors properly turned/placed in your field of view would be a better solution, but this one ultra-wide is definitely a better looking option, and you don't have any bezels in between your views.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Wilson

customer_reviews.title: HDR gaming is awesome! BF1 looks amazing
customer_reviews.text: Ok, So I was really on the fence on this purchase. But after a month I have to say its really grown on me and I likely can not downgrade in size moving forward. I am Jaded! HDR gaming is awesome! BF1 looks amazing, gives you a much realistic game play and immersion. Vertically as everyone says it sucks. Form some reason my PUBG game lobby area will only allow me to see the players body not the head! picture below. Other than that the monition is pretty awesome. lots of real estate for work.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: First one sent to me was an open box. NO THANK YOU! Not at this price! The second came and was new. After a few months the display port went bad and I'm limited to using HDMI which is limits screen refresh. Not that big a deal, I didn't return again, but it's still pretty subpar for something with this size price tag. I use it for work (databases), give me enough room for approx 3 27" screens and all that room comes in handy. In retrospect, I should have just bought 3 screens and the mounting for them.
customer_reviews.author: Arioc

customer_reviews.title: For Business: An amazing time saver.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing display. Admittedly, I'm not a gamer. I don't play video games. I am using mine strictly for business. The ability to partition the screen into multiple displays so that Excel can be on one screen right next to a database application or an accounting package is such a time saver.
customer_reviews.author: MC501

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor horrible chat support
customer_reviews.text: Monitor is great. Had to change settings on Nvidia 1080gtxs as i was getting screen tearing. (fully disable G-Sync) Upgrade the firmware as soon as you get the monitor. Directions say FAT32 and NTFS work but only thing that worked for me was a USB formatted with FAT. Chat support don't even think about it... better off just inserting you head up your ..... well you get idea. UPDATE: Monitor is still working fine issue is nothing supports the resolutions well. Most games and apps just cut the top and bottom off. (not really a monitor issue but wish i knew this before I purchased.)
customer_reviews.author: J. Beckus

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Amateur Radio Station
customer_reviews.text: Wow! That pretty much describes my experience and everyone's reaction when they see this beautiful monitor in action. This replaces two side by side monitors for my amateur radio station. The ultra wide display ratio allows the Flex Radio, logging, rotor control and spotting screens to be on top at all times and perfect size to navigate and display proper size, easy to read fonts. The curve and mat finish non-reflective surface provides an awesome and very immersive experience.
customer_reviews.author: BG_NorCal

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTE GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my first one from Amazon and it had burn marks all over the screen like it was refurbished. I returned it and got the replacement. The replacement worked for a fewndays, then vertical lines started showing up in bunches. This MONITOR is GARBAGE. DO NOT BUY!!!! I tried to upload the video showing the problem, but Amazon's app wont let me. I just got scammed by amazon. I bought 3 monitors (2 samsung ultrawide curved and 1 scepter ultrawide curved), and all of them were defective/garbage.
customer_reviews.author: AAL

customer_reviews.title: Amazing monitor!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the best monitor I have ever owned. I just wish I had the money to buy 3! This thing is heavy with a big wide stand, so I'm not worried about it falling over at all. The only thing this monitor is missing is TV shows and movies being filmed in this format. A dream for another day. I switch between Picture by Picture for work and one picture for gaming and this performs those functions flawlessly. Until there is a software way to full screen Plex, Netflix, and Games on half of a full screen, PBP is the perfect solution! Samsung, once again, you rock and constantly make me need to buy a bigger desk! <3
customer_reviews.author: William Lockette

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for games and work. I was a little worried with the 1080 vertical resolution with text being blurry, but it works amazing. I work as a software engineer, having the extra screen space is fantastic. Games look fantastic on this. The only downside is that some games don't like working with ultrawide resolutions (I'm looking at you unreal4 engine). Even with that, gaming is a blast! Honestly, if I did this again, I would get the same monitor, but with the 1440 vertical resolution. Maybe next year.. :)
customer_reviews.author: Adam Dewing

customer_reviews.title: My Son was So Jealous =  )
customer_reviews.text: Work that Screen Girl, I have a 27. iMac, in the shop cracked during one of my Diva Tantrums. So I went shopping and decided on a curved screen. My son (To Young To know that Size Really Matters) suggested a 32 inch curved screen. Mommy did some research on her own a got this 48'in monster to lay out my reports and attach my XBOX that he doesn't know about. I attached my HDMI to my laptop and got my "Bold & the Beautiful / The Young and The Restless Grove On" Don't Tell me Parents don't know how to have fun. My son, doesn't speak to me anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Gwendolyn de Ashborough

customer_reviews.title: Holy Screen Door Batman
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and shell out a little more for a smaller, 1440p model. The 49” of screen real estate is absolutely wonderful. But then you quickly realize it’s still only 1080p and you’re looking at a pixel density of 81ppi. From a foot or two back it’s not as bad, but I couldn’t find a reasonable distance to make it work. It’s honestly a shame as the color accuracy and brightness are fantastic. Turning on HDR makes the whole screen unacceptably dark, tho, and completely washes out the colors. Also, I bought mine used ‘like new’ and it worked for about 15 minutes out of the box. Then in the middle of a game the panel just died.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Dean

customer_reviews.title: HUGE field of view
customer_reviews.text: Monitor has been great, this sucker is HUGE. If i am being honest it might be a bit big for some people. Works great for multiple windows at once while editing and working on projects. But onto gaming! its been a BLAST! games look gorgeous and the ridiculous FOV has taken a bit of getting used to but its been amazing! Hookup was very easy and the stand/base is very stable but it does add a bit of width so make sure you have a deep desk .
customer_reviews.author: Cross

customer_reviews.title: Samsung support - horrible
customer_reviews.text: The monitor was working for 4 months. Now it turns on, but will not recognize any signal from any PC plugged into it (HDMI/DP/nothing). Over the last 4 days, trying to get support, I have been disconnected 5 times. I have been told a support ticket to help fix the monitor would be created (It did not). I have been told to carry the 35 pounds, ultra-wide monitor to a walk-in support location around me (No idea what or where this is and no answers ever are given). Been transferred numerous times, only to get to no answers. The Samsung Support experience they are striving for, is the worst experience I have had in a LONG time.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C. Leonforte

customer_reviews.title: Life at the fingertip!
customer_reviews.text: I am a work at home mom. More of a techno person. I am at a promising role in my organization, where multi tasking is must. However life does not spare anyone. One gets easily bored of routine and i get burned out often. To add some spice to my work, i bought this monitor. Now when i work i am altogether at a different world and my productivity has increased. I have to install easy split from Samsung to split the screen. I dont have any other techincal details about the monitor. I am just enjoying it at the rate of refresh ;)
customer_reviews.author: Sneha Ponnusamy

customer_reviews.title: 1080p bezzles behemoth
customer_reviews.text: Its very wide and is honestly the best size I would need for a desktop pc setup. The brightness and color accuracy is adequate, adjustability is good. The support for such a screen isn't mainstream yet. I have trouble putting a separate youtube video on one side of the screen into full screen mode without it completely taking over the whole screen instead of just taking up half like a typical dual screen setup. Overall very resposive for games and great for multitasking and basic 1080p video editing.
customer_reviews.author: Sanzo

customer_reviews.title: Wake up issues, games don't fit, NO crosshair.
customer_reviews.text: Every few times I would awake the computer the monitor would wake with pink lines all over the screen, also many PC games wouldn't fit, the screen would cut the feet or head off characters. This monitor should have been made with a taller Y axis, also NO built in crosshair feature like other gaming monitors.
customer_reviews.author: voltaire andrews

customer_reviews.title: Dead pixels from the start
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box.... dead pixels.... something that cost over $1000 should come without defects. Also the resolution just isnt what it needs to be at 1080..... would be a great monitor if not for arriving with dead pixels though.
customer_reviews.author: Keith S.

customer_reviews.title: Great but doesn't handle inputs intuitively
customer_reviews.text: This monitor works exactly as expected except for one caveat... It has 4 inputs. I use 2 for my home PC and one for my work laptop. I use the two when in PBP mode and the other when not in that mode. If I'm not in PBP mode, I can't just turn that mode on; I have to select a video input that's being used for PBP then it enables the option to choose that mode. But when I choose it, I have to reconfigure the screen that I just changed. Then I have the same problem going back. If it had the option to save which screens are selected per mode it would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Amazing monitor! Coming from a 4k monitor I thought I would hate it being 1080p but it makes sense on Samsung's part considering it's 144hz. At first the resolution bugged me a bit but you get used to it and you start to look passed that and really enjoy the monitor. I use it for gaming in it is absolutely worth it! Some games I have to run at a 21:9 ratio (regular ultrawide) like PUBG or AC: Black Flag but it's still a great monitor to have. Hardly any screen tearing and HDR is amazing. Running on an i3-8350k/GTX1080 combo. Most games run over 100fps for me.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Bigger is better...
customer_reviews.text: Loyal Samsung fan and this monitor further establishes that. It really is a glorious monster! Not a big gamer, but what I have played.. Wow.. New meaning to immersive.. Regarding the concerns of font and icon clarity? Well, of course it is a 1080 display so to be expected, but not one person in the many that have come to see this thing has ever complained that the icons are pixelated.. Have used for about a month now and still in awe of the overall scope of this monitor. Highly recommend for anyone looking for more monitor real estate, gaming, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Nice 360 degree appearance.  Quality image.  Stand could be taller.
customer_reviews.text: I've been enjoying this monitor for several months now. I don't really do any gaming, but I love the extended desktop area for multiple open windows without having to deal with a multi-monitor setup any more. I'd rate the monitor quality 5/5. The image quality is very good, and the smooth appearance of the back are great for setups where the back of the monitor will be seen. I only dinged it a star for the monitor stand, which isn't really able to adjust as high as I would like. I can fix this with an aftermarket stand of course, but I wouldn't have needed to if it were just taller. Overall I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: See everything
customer_reviews.text: Tired of your friends roasting you for having a 30fps monitor that's taller than it is wider. Tired of having a max of 30% field of view cause if you increase you cant see anything. Going on those scientific sites and want to have cyristal clear picture quality for better research on your favorite scientists. Look no further than this monitor, never have I ever finished a paper and stacked bodies in cod with such ease. With the capability to have 2 displays on one monitor you can have all the gaming, researching, "researching", and movie watching you want. Garrenteed.
customer_reviews.author: Dan ponzio

customer_reviews.title: Friends are all jealous.
customer_reviews.text: Have had it about 4 days now. I love it. Only drawbacks: PC would not boot w/DP connected, no idea what that was about; and I really wish the vertical rez was a little better (1080 kinda sucks on this monster.) I was able to work around the DP with HDMI. Other than that it's working great. Not as much real estate as my previous 3-screen setup, but this is nice with no bezels in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Brains Ironically

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Bought this monitor for my gaming son. He loves it over multiple monitors side by side. Couple of notes: This sucker is heavy but it is easy to assemble the stand. Attach the stand to the monitor FIRST. Easy to plug and play. My son calibrated the color and the games pop and are immersive. One gripe: Although the factory packing was good, the factory box was poorly packed inside a larger cardboard box and could slop around.. Lucky no damage!
customer_reviews.author: Poser906

customer_reviews.title: Awesome all around.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is fantastic for business as well as gaming. Being able to have multiple windows open for different applications and not to have the bezel of different monitors disrupting the view is great. Being able to toggle between inputs is a great help for switching between devices. I was surprised that I did not need to download a new video driver. The newer laptop that the company provided just took over the whole screen as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: erdp

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE it but
customer_reviews.text: I'm returning it. I LOVE it but... not much supports the resolution and even half-ing the screen made my remote desktops look weird and remote/screen sharing sessions (which I do a lot of for work) to. The only reason I am returning it and not giving it 5 stars it's simply ahead of it's time. Samsung, cut 2 inches off this monitor on either side and bump it about 3 inches taller and you are flying again. Sticking with my old Samsung 34inch until I find better.
customer_reviews.author: Skunkchunks

customer_reviews.title: Known issues with monitor come to life on the 2 I bought.
customer_reviews.text: It worked great but now 16 months later I have this issue and the top one is also doing it but once it warmed up it stop. The bottom one use to just do it when it’s cold but not it’s shot. I would not recommend this monitor at all. 2k down the drain. You are better of getting 2x 27” monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crappy resolution but a fantastically large 1080p
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing, looks great and works great. I gave it 4 stars simple for this one reason: it should really be an 8k monitor. It currently sits at 3840x1080 but is said to be two 16/9 side by side. During gameplay the size is fantastic but since it’s only 1080p it leaves a little to be desired. Unless you want the size right now, I’d suggest waiting for an update or another product providing 2160p or a true 8k. Also watch for sales, I bought it a month ago and it already went down 100$.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy henderson

customer_reviews.title: Bad for console and laptop multi tasking
customer_reviews.text: I liked the design, but that's the only thing. When I connected my laptop and ps4 to it. Dual input screen didn't work. My ps4 pro was so stretched it was hard to read the menus. This monitor is only great with pc gaming. Don't bother to buy if you have console.
customer_reviews.author: Shahboz U Sharipov

customer_reviews.title: Looks much better than i expected.
customer_reviews.text: Everyone is saying the resolution is bad. Honesly i came from a 4k monitor and dont notice a difference. This is mainly because i sit farther back as it is much larger. Also, you only need onr display port connection or 1 hdmi connection to run it. I have a selfbuilt hp omen x, and the monitor takes full advantage of the titan xp. It may not have g sync but it does have free sync. Its control pannel is great, and it comes with plenty of ports. Below are some pictures i took of how great this monitor looks
customer_reviews.author: DanielFJ

customer_reviews.title: not a bad monitor but do your research first
customer_reviews.text: all in all its not a bad monitor but if you are like me and play a lot of older games that were not designed for 3840-1080 you will realize that your games will look very stretched and weird looking, now you can partition the screen with the app on samsungs website but it doesnt always work. but if you do play shooters such as call of duty, destiny or apex then the exra rlom is very nice also there is a bug in apex with this monitor or other super ultrawides that if you a right next to a wall you can see through it not very helpful but very funny
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: WOW WOW AND AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: Recently recieved it and i soon as i open i fell inlove! Its such a beautiful and big monitor. Only downside is that theres ni built in speaker. But i think its worth the money. I was worried about the review about the issues their having, so far so good. But we will see in the next few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Barr A

customer_reviews.title: Best monitor ever!
customer_reviews.text: Love this monitor! It’s massive, great for gaming, editing, browsing the web, anything really. Picture quality is fantastic, and it’s easy to use. I’ve owned dozens of monitors over the years and this one is by far my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Rollingstone

customer_reviews.title: Pixels are bigger than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This beast replaced 4 budget 1920 x 1080 monitors. However, this monitor is close to 3 inches taller, but with the same vertical pixel count. As a result the pixels are in fact larger than what I had grown accustomed to. One other complaint is the length of the cords provided. If your computer is any distance away from the monitor I'd suggest you look into buying a longer cord. No dead pixels. screen was beautiful right out of the box (and its a big box).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Videos are horrible on both of mine.
customer_reviews.text: Great for Flight Sim, sucks for videos. Faces are blotchy and lighting is all wrong. I tried all settings and both amd and nvidia cards. That said, Nvidia 1060 is best for overall performance & efficiency, reguardless it's being equipped with AMD Freesync which imho is a worthless feature. Also... at 120 and 144hz the monitor's upper corners get VERY warm, made me think the plastic could melt, so I run them at 60hz. They make excellent productivity screens.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix1969

customer_reviews.title: NO SOUND
customer_reviews.text: This monitor has a major problem with sound. After reading the forums for last few hours trying to get this problem resolved it hasn't happened or its a huge inconvenience. I hooked it up to my ps4 and allowed all the options to allow sound and still nothing. It will play the sound through the head set but thats it. Only other option I see is spending even more money on some PC speakers to plug into the monitor to get sound. Unacceptable on a $1000 monitor!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: An amazing purchase
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I'd been rocking a 3 head display for several years with no real issues. But when I caught sight of this beauty I KNEW I had to have it. Every single person who has seen it is in awe, just like I am every day I sit in front of it. It Pro: Crisp picture, no dead pixels, great response time for gaming, ultra wide display let's me fit 3 open windows Con: Expensive, resolution could be higher (like my 3 head display), when waking up from power save mode, my Win10 forgets screen resolution which requires a power cycle of the monitor
customer_reviews.author: Justin Anderson

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is one of the best monitor on the market and the quality is second to none love this monitor. One thing to note if you don't have a lot of space this monitor is not for you. This monitor is made really high quality materials and design is second to none. The picture quality is the best on the market and refresh rate is the best there is love this monitor I would highly recommend this monitor it's a bit expensive.
customer_reviews.author: INNERHEIGH

customer_reviews.title: Lots of real estate!
customer_reviews.text: Really nice monitor. I was initially concerned with the resolution but it turned out to be a non issue. I use it for stock trading and it is great in this application. I am not a gamer so I cant speak to that but I really like it. Now if I could just get 2 more and a new Nvidia graphics card and I might get into gaming...
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: We are in love with these
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend and i each bought one for our gaming room. We had previously been using T.V.s. these are amazing. Great picture, easy to put together and so many ways to adjust the screen. I don't think we will ever leave the house again. Lol. Delivered on time and exactly what we wanted. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa D

customer_reviews.title: plenty of real estate but far from perfect function.
customer_reviews.text: great as far as screen size goes, but one of the hdmi inputs was bad from day one and it has an issue where it will go lime green (the complete screen) and require a reboot of the system. its damn heavy too.
customer_reviews.author: Quiettune

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 uses.
customer_reviews.text: Had it in the box for a month without using it. When I finally opened it, everything seemed fine. After 3 uses, the screen turned completely white. You couldn’t see anything. Had to call Samsung in order to fix the problem. They are currently helping me.
customer_reviews.author: xiamy

customer_reviews.title: Not for gaming
customer_reviews.text: As much as I would love to game on this, Its just not for gaming. go with a 35in ultra wide 1440 over this. For productivity its amazing, 2 things open on one screen works great. After 5mo, blue line down side and warranty wont cover it. They said sorry no one near your area to look at it. I live near a big city.
customer_reviews.author: raven

customer_reviews.title: Works superbly well with my MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for a few weeks now. Amazing display, syncs right up with my MacBook even when woken up from sleep mode. It replaces my 2 27" displays. Couldn't have made a better choice than going with one display versus two! Make sure you have a deep desk as the stand is quite large.
customer_reviews.author: M. Haider

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this for a MacBook!
customer_reviews.text: The fonts are extremely blurry when used with a MacBook. It is virtually unusable the resolution is so bad. This is at 3840x1080, the highest it goes. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Dry-Good but no speakers... I assume speakers will be included
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe that a 1000 us dollars monitor doesn't have speakers. It is not documented at all. I am kind of mad and disaponted. The competion mention speakers and lower price. Ok... What is the gain here ?!
customer_reviews.author: ram

customer_reviews.title: Nice but comes with set backs
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Monitor is nice, great angles. Very sleek and fast. Cons: It came with a dead pixel which is really infuriating. Whenever the monitor is turned off, sometimes you have to unplug the monitor and even restart the computer to get a signal back. Having to do this multiple times a day is probably bad for the monitor life. I really hope this can be addressed.
customer_reviews.author: Kain

customer_reviews.title: Awesome monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Had this monitor for a few months now. Bought it to eliminate the need for two monitors. Must say it works very well, just be sure your laptop or PC will support the resolution. Had to spend a little extra money for a video card for my PC, but it works great now. Laptop worked fine! Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly after setup. Unbelievable picture quality.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is the equivalent of 2 1920x1080 screens curved and wrapping side by side, but it presents gorgeous visuals with a clarity that makes my previous 1920x1080 panels look both dim and blurry. It also has 2 USB 3.0 ports on the back. I'm hoping that games will catch up to supporting this ultra-wide screen format. To say the least, I am very pleased and excited to have it, though I may get sunburn, because of its brightness and the clarity of its colors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best monitor ever owned, yes for gaming too
customer_reviews.text: This monitor... I love it so much. I will never go to a non ultawide 49" again. On top of being a hard core gamer I'm also a game art student at Full Sail university (amazing school btw) so I always have a need for a second monitor and this ultawide solves my issue by providing an enormous screen realestate. The 144hz is very noticeably smooth. Cons: The weight of this monitor makes finding a monitor arm impossible. (Do not buy the Loctek D7L it will not work, I've tested it) Ignore any statistic about HDR regarding this monitor. Turning it on in games is horrendous. This is not an HDR monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Amador

customer_reviews.title: Best thing since sliced bread. Love the PBP.
customer_reviews.text: I use it primary for business as a dual screen monitor. Love the versatility and cleanness of the design.
customer_reviews.author: Verified Buyer-39

customer_reviews.title: great screen, stable, buy it
customer_reviews.text: The screen is long. The stand makes it very stable. Well thought out. The screen width allows for lots of data visualization. It doesn't get warm when using it (some get screens get hot). This is also used with a old 40in tv for all the info I have to look at. I use this screen over the tv since I can get more windows on the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: Will it fit my Ikea desk?
customer_reviews.text: The monitor is beautiful and does a great job on all its features it offers. My biggest hesitation of getting this monitor is if it will fit on my desks in-between two shelves. I finally pulled the trigger on got it.At first I removed my bottom shelf and let it sit on my desk. I soon realize it can be sit comfortably raised by the desk shelf. The desk I use is a very common selling desk from IKEA. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Taing

customer_reviews.title: love this thing - if they had a stand that ...
customer_reviews.text: love this thing - if they had a stand that would allow me to use another one on top of the one i have, i would buy it and another screen instantly. - Update. I got a little creative and constructed my own stand so that I could run two of these monitors one on top of the other. I am an extremely happy camper! And when I do a video and show my screen setup in the background, I always get people with blown minds reaching out to me about my killer setup!
customer_reviews.author: Avid Online Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Such a cool monitor and topic starter
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy the monitor and everyone who comes by always asks about it. I really enjoy talking about it and watching people be like oh wow. Such a good product. Kinda pricey but worth the money to a true gamer.
customer_reviews.author: LadyReviews4fun

customer_reviews.title: The thing is huuuuuge
customer_reviews.text: I have to build a ton of documents/decks for work which requires me to have multiple files open at once. It's a GRIND to have to do it on my 13" laptop screen. Now I'll have no issues working through everything. I'm interested in adjusting the settings of the screen. When I first turned it on, it was incredibly bright. I found the way to adjust the brightness and it's much better on the eyes; I want to figure out how to make more adjustments, as I'll be looking at this screen for 10 hours a day. I'll update this review as I get familiar with the screen.
customer_reviews.author: James Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Wasn’t sure if it was a gimmick or not
customer_reviews.text: I went from three 1080p acer monitors to this, it’s way more productive for video editing. Might not be great for gaming but not having a bezel and having it appear as one monitor can be very useful. There also an app Samsung makes for snapping windows which helps with web surfing etc
customer_reviews.author: Jason F

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor, just lots of problems while gaming
customer_reviews.text: For me personally, i have a 1070 with a eight core processor, unfortunately that did not seem to be enough to game on League of Legends, or any game for that matter. There was constant screen tearing, to the point you could only browse the web and not play anything cpu or gpu intensive. Even with the freesync on and other settings changed to fix the screen tear, nothing really worked, vsync neither. This monitor is good if you have a 1080ti+ if u want to game with, because anything below it will lag alot and screen tear with high gpu usage because of the sheer size of the monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Shakti Patel

customer_reviews.title: Don't touch the screen under any circumstance
customer_reviews.text: The screen is pathetically weak. I picked the monitor up with my hands. Put it on the mount with minimal physical effort and when I looked at the screen the left hand side LCD screen had been cracked. Monitor is completely useless. Samsung support offers no valid offers short of spending another $975 to get it fixed (basically buy a new monitor). I will chalk this up as a loss and will never buy a samsung again after dealing with their lack of support and brittle product.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Samsung very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The monitor died today mar 25 I only had it since November, if I knew I would not have bought it, better with a regular monitor
customer_reviews.author: nimr sleiman

customer_reviews.title: Monitor may come broken. Otherwise good
customer_reviews.text: I was sent 2 malfunctioning monitors. The first one has screen failure, the second one had dead pixels. Im on my third replacement but it's a pain to send back because it's bulky. Gaming is ok it is big and for high level gaming it's emersive but you have to turn your head a lot. Low level gaming you'll love it. Also it's only 1080 keep that in mind for the people who care about 4k.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful monitor. Was worried a bit about the limited height but it really does not matter any when gaming. No bad pixels. Great immersive experience and lots of desktop space for many windows to view at one time. Planning to bump the video card up to a GTX 1080ti from a GTX 970 for better performance but GTA5 for example ran noticeably smoother on this monitor compared to my previous Dell S2718D. Disappointed that Nvidia G-sync is not supported so hopeful Samsung will make this adjustment going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Ostermeyer

customer_reviews.title: If you have the desk space and money, go ahead
customer_reviews.text: I love this monitor. SO much real estate to work with. I can have like 3-4 windows open comfortably. Also great for games like fortnite etc.. Best mix of productivity and gaming. However you need 2 adults to set up. Very heavy and large monitor. Especially cables are kind of annoying to deal with due to the angle they enter the back of the monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Sai

customer_reviews.title: Try to get a refund asap
customer_reviews.text: This product has been a huge issue from day one, i ordered it and it melted the lcd from the backlit panel, then proceeded to replace it with a new one, samsung service had gone and replaced with a refurbished one. I had over 10 services scheduled and samsung proceeded to not contact the repair contractors, the contractors cancelled becuase they don't do residential, or they never showed up on scheduled days and went silent. The screen has been an issue always and I wish I had made a refund and return when available, make sure you do too.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Kadlec

customer_reviews.title: Burn in after a month of use
customer_reviews.text: This monitor was great, until it wasn't. Eventually I realized I was able to see outlines of my windows when my screen was supposed to be displaying grey. I noticed it just after the return window, so I Amazon wouldn't give me a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: expressj

customer_reviews.title: This thing is HUGE
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is massive. I didn't realize how big it was and I'm very pleased with it. Packaging is top notch. Clear installation instructions - they even include cables. Video quality is very clear,
customer_reviews.author: Mike Steinhoff

customer_reviews.title: Super monitor but it is not 144hz as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gaming monitor, the picture is amazing and the controls are much easier to use than they were on my 32-inch curved screen Samsung monitor. The only thing I didn't like was that it is only 120hz, not 144hz...
customer_reviews.author: Rekkof

customer_reviews.title: not usable as a workstation monitor
customer_reviews.text: I purchased thinking i could use this as a workstation and gaming monitor. The 1080 resolution is terrible for anything work related. Not usable as a workstation at all. The letters and digits on screen are rough to look at, and super annoying to look at all day. Im sure its great at gaming, but that's probably it. I am returning for a monitor that has better resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases I've ever made!!!!
customer_reviews.text: They will have to remove this monitor from my cold dead hands! It's literally life changing! I will NEVER go back to a lesser monitor of any sort again. After using a 49 inch curved 4k adjustable screen nothing else seems good in comparison!
customer_reviews.author: Thebestbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Resolution stopping you?
customer_reviews.text: My biggest concern purchasing this monitor was that it was only 1080p and not 4K. While it is noticeable if you have been working on a 4K monitor, with this monitor you sit further back to accommodate the amazing wingspan, which corrects for the lower resolution. The colors and responsiveness of this monitor are awesome, the colors are noticeably rich and deep while the response time makes gaming fluid and smooth. 100% love this monitor. Do make sure that your desk can accommodate its larger than usual footprint and support stand
customer_reviews.author: 5ton

customer_reviews.title: Best decision I've ever made
customer_reviews.text: If youre doubting ultrawide displays id suggest you buy this and try it out I felt weird at first but you get used to it Refresh rate really is 144 and response time is insane If youre using for gaming and want to take advantage of the full display make sure it supports ultrawide If it does, then fps games youre gonna be golden
customer_reviews.author: Kevin O

customer_reviews.title: wow!!! Much better than expected
customer_reviews.text: wow!!! This is my big investment so I review almost all reviews to make sure it's a good one. After reading about low resolution for text, I was skeptical because I use this mostly for work which uses MS office heavily. I am happy to report that I have no problem reading text and there's no dead pixel so far. I'll update if there's any problem later. Also I have a 3-monitor-32-inch setup as another workstation. Now, it's just amazing for the ultrawide view WITHOUT the bezel. If you're a serious gamer or a heavy MS office user, GET this.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Vo

customer_reviews.title: Tip: Update the firmware
customer_reviews.text: Many users report a problem with the monitor staying black when waking from sleep, or long periods of time spent waking the monitor. This can be addressed by updating the firmware on the monitor. It's a manual process involving a USB drive. Not too hard. The newest driver from March 2019 fixes the issue. I love this monitor for Sim Racing - it provides a huge FOV, and high refresh rates.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great device but failing after less than a year.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this screen for about eight months, I love the look and the picture is really good.. BUT, about 20% of the time when I turn it on, I just see lines across the screen, I have to unplug it, wait a few seconds, then plug it back in again. I'm not sure how much longer it will last. I'm upset that it's not even a year old yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Ford F-450 of Computer Monitors
customer_reviews.text: I saw this and I immediately thought “yeah, that’s what I want to build my computer set up around”. I purchased this back in March for around $860.00. This is definitely pricey, but man does it feel cool to sit down in front of this and start playing. All in all, this is the most impressive monitor I’ve ever owned; the only real problem I ran into was my need to get rid of it because my new apartment had a built in computer alcove that was too small to accommodate. This is the Ford F-450 of computer monitors, bigger than you have any need for, but so much fun to drive.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor H. Medlin

customer_reviews.title: A great monitor for multi-taskers and gamers
customer_reviews.text: A great monitor for multi-taskers and gamers. I am using mine for work and play. Three docs wide for work and 3280x1080 for gaming. Would be nice to be able to configure as two to three separate monitors for split screen applications like presentations where you may be editing in one frame and presenting in the other. That's just a nit though as it performs extremely well for 4K gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Egan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing workspace
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is great for gaming as well as workspace. Older games work fine in a windowed mode, but it takes some getting used to. Multiple windows for work is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Submarine

customer_reviews.title: Challenging to install and manage. Not stable.
customer_reviews.text: We've had tons of trouble stabilizing this monitor. The trouble started the moment we plugged it into our PC. It affected all kind of things we'd never expect from adding a monitor. After achieving a configuration, the monitor randomly stops functioning properly and requires significant time to recover. When it is working, its fantastic, especially with Battlefield.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: A beasty monitor!!!
customer_reviews.text: I freaking love this monitor! It’s huge and most games run super ultra wide which is freaking breathtaking. You better have a card that can handle it though. I’m using a Strix 1080ti and it runs like a dream. Just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Screen decided to blow up after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Well sadly i was going to write a review on this product after 6 months of use.... but the screen went out after 5 months and well when it was working it was a great monitor. after talking with tech support from both amazon and samsung low behold not covered under any warranty as the screens are not covered under any policy. "Samsung LC49HG90DMNXZA CHG90 will cost more to repair than would be to buy new." Lesson learned Thanks Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: Denny Roth

customer_reviews.title: Never going back to multi monitor display again
customer_reviews.text: Excellent space. No bezel. Basically 2 1080p monitors sidebyside without bezel. *what the future monitor should be in 2020* -1 Cant get the QLED feature to do much of anything. It just makes the screen grayer. Dont see any difference in Fortnite. Comparing to OLED, QLED is not much different from led.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: 1+ Year Review
customer_reviews.text: I have had this monitor for about a year and so far it has been wonderful. No, the picture sharpness is not the greatest, but when you're a few feet away from the monitor to see the entire screen, it doesn't really matter. All of my games look spectacular, and I can see much more at once than on a standard wide monitor. Just be aware it DOES NOT have built-in speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Beast
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. 1080p vertical resolution may be an issue if coming from 4K to this, otherwise it looks great. Dual input is great for side by side gaming as well if you have two computers. Laptop and Amazon fire stick connected in picture. The stand feet are massive and take up a lot of room.
customer_reviews.author: SeekingGlory

customer_reviews.title: Amazing monitor!
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit on the pricey side, but it delivers. Most games support the resolution (although some, you may notice that all they did was stretch the sides - Left 4 Dead 2, for instance). But the picture clarity is amazing, and it is immersive like nothing I've ever seen. It's disappointing to game on anything else once you're on this thing. (Jurassic World: Evolution, pictured.)
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: dead pixels, 3 clusters
customer_reviews.text: If it didn't have 3 clusters of dead pixels this display would be wonderful. It saddens me that my beloved Samsung is sending out so many of these with dead pixels. Just look at the other reviews... If you need to charge more to send out your products without this kind of flaw Samsung, just do that. I am disappointed in you.
customer_reviews.author: Jaekov

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: beautiful monitor. bought it to work from home. amazing quality i work with tons of excel sheets and multiple tax softwares. the monitor makes me more efficient. i can look straight at things vs turning my head as i did with having two monitors enjoying it very much so
customer_reviews.author: Masha Taruntayeva

product_meta.title: Samsung 49-Inch CHG90 144Hz Curved Gaming Monitor (LC49HG90DMNXZA) – Super Ultrawide Screen QLED Computer Monitor, 3840 x 1080p Resolution, 1ms Response, FreeSync 2 with HDR
product_meta.description: The curved super ultrawide 32:9 aspect ratio Samsung 49-Inch CHG90 144Hz Curved Gaming Monitor (LC49HG90DMNXZA) boasts a massive amount of real estate on one chassis. Designed for gaming development, video creation and editing, and any business application with fast moving content, the CHG90 series monitor delivers a crisp and clear experience that fills your field of view. Meanwhile, Quantum Dot technology makes the games you play appear even more vivid and lifelike thanks to a billion (yes, billion, with a b!) shades of accurate color. Reds are redder and blues are bluer with Samsung. This Samsung monitor is great for any gaming computer and is an easy upgrade from a multiple monitor setup that lets you view spreadsheets and multiple windows like never before. This 49-inch super ultrawide monitor is truly built for speed. With advanced motion blur reduction technology plus a superior VA panel, this monitor offers a lightning quick 1ms MPRT (Motion Picture Response Time) which offers you unparalleled gaming performance. Best of all, the 1800R curved panel keeps you totally immersed in your gameplay while also delivering cinematic viewing for movies and video content. Why bother to go to the movies at all when you have this Samsung QLED monitor?
